intro: Brachystelma nallamalayanum, commonly known as the Nallamalai star-flower, is a species of flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, which is commonly referred to as the ice plant family. This succulent plant is characterized by its small, star-shaped flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink and white. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing on rocky outcrops or in sandy soils. The plant's adaptations include thick, fleshy leaves that help store water, making it well-suited for drought conditions.
